ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ fʉʼó ŋwɛ́, atsɔ́ guɔ gwoon fùɔ Ezekiyásè tà ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ye legwé. Esǎyà ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé gẅie aa míŋ Ámɔ́sè wembàŋa tó ńgyá yé ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Anò gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔ̌ɔn á yɔɔn: Táŋte tsìŋendá jú, ńtí nue ɔ̀ ge kwé, ɔ̀ těen ńgee ńtsẅɛ́ɛ wɔ́.»
en: In those days Hezekiah became terminally ill.   The prophet Isaiah son of Amoz came and said to him, “This is what the Lord says: ‘Set your house in order,  # 38:1 2Sm 17:23 for you are about to die; you will not recover.’ ”  # 38:1 Lit live

ngiemboon: Ezekiyásè júʼ púʼu, ńtém nzèm ńnáa ssé ndá. É sẅíŋte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a,
en: Then Hezekiah turned his face to the wall and prayed to the Lord.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn ngie: «Tsetsɔ́ʼ me Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, e sẅíŋte gú, kímte páʼ n ka lɔgɔ pyennɛ́ ńgiŋ páʼ ɔ̀ ne ńkwoŋo, ḿbú ńná letʉ́m sɔ́ɔn mbwó gù, ńgÿo pɔ́ mmó gie á ge poŋo gú!» Ezekiyásè gɔɔn púʼu, ḿbú ńdʉa.
en: He said, “Please, Lord, remember how I have walked before you faithfully and wholeheartedly,   and have done what pleases you.”  # 38:3 Dt 6:18 And Hezekiah wept bitterly.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tsẅi né Esǎyà ngie
en: Then the word of the Lord came to Isaiah:

ngiemboon: à gʉa ńgɔɔn mbwó Ezekiyásè ngie: «Mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé Fùɔ Ndavîd gẅie aa mángʉanjʉʼ gẅi, n juʼú sẅíŋtè jú, ńgyá ntse nÿɔ́g mú, n ge kẅiʼi mengùʼ ntsɔ̀b tʉ̂a né legém na mengùʼu láʼ mú,
en: “Go and tell Hezekiah, ‘This is what the Lord God of your ancestor David says: I have heard your prayer; I have seen your tears. Look, I am going to add fifteen years to your life.  ,# 38:5 2Kg 18:2,13

ngiemboon: n ge kẅé gẅí lâ Yelúzálèm na mbwó fùɔ Asili; n ge kábte yɔɔn tÿǒsoŋ. É piŋ pɔ́ɔnte yɔɔn tÿǒsoŋ.»
en: And I will rescue you and this city from the grasp of the king of Assyria; I will defend this city.

ngiemboon: Esǎyà tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge gÿo nyɛɛ gú ngie à gɔɔn nò, ńtÿɔ́gɔ kwò mǒ. À liŋé gie à ge gÿo lɔg nyɛɛ gú, á yɔɔn:
en: This is the sign to you   from the Lord that he will do what he has promised:

ngiemboon: Akaze gẅie á kɔʼɔ́ ńtyé ndùm mesetɔ̂b, á na nèm, jʉ́jʉ́ŋ we sẅɛ́ʼ tà ńkúu ssé, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge gÿo jʉ́jʉ́ŋ Akaze gíŋe ńkwɔ́ʼ mesetɔ̂b legém.» Nèm leen ńké ńgíŋe ḿbiŋe na mesetɔ̂b legém mie jʉ́jʉ́ŋ kɔʼɔ́ ńgwɔ́ mǒ.
en: I am going to make the sun’s shadow that goes down on the stairway of Ahaz go back by ten steps.’ ”   So the sun’s shadow  # 38:8 Lit And the sun went back the ten steps it had descended.

ngiemboon: Azɔ̀b gie Ezekiyásè fùɔ pà Yúndà la guɔ tà sẅéte ńŋweʼe ayɔɔn:
en: A poem by King Hezekiah of Judah after he had been sick and had recovered from his illness:

ngiemboon: N ka ńkwaŋ pɔ́ ngie:
en: I said: In the prime   of my life  # 38:10 Ps 102:24

ngiemboon: N ka gǐŋ ne ńkwaŋa ngie:
en: I said: I will never see the  Lord,

ngiemboon: Mé kéen saʼa wɔ̀ɔn legwɔ́,
en: My dwelling is plucked up and removed from me

ngiemboon: Njÿó ge gwaa lʉ́a,
en: I thought until the morning:

ngiemboon: Ngyè yɔ̀ɔn cʉ̌ʼ ńgwɔ́
en: I chirp like a swallow or a crane;

ngiemboon: Táʼ, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mèŋ n gɔɔn ngie kɔ́,
en: What can I say?

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ɔ̀ ka zsé nò gie á ka gyá wɔ́ɔn,
en: Lord, by such things people live,

ngiemboon: Máa ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ gie e ka kúu wɔ́ɔn,
en: Indeed, it was for my own well-being

ngiemboon: Áa láʼ mepfó,
en: For Sheol cannot thank you;

ngiemboon: Ngwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie ée ntʉ̀ntʉ̀,
en: The living, only the living can thank you,

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a,
en: The Lord is ready to save me;

ngiemboon: Esǎyà gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: «Pi pi membaŋ pÿɛ̀ me njǔm ńgwɔʼ, ńdɔg ńtó ńzába na fʉ̌ŋ fùɔ, à sẅéte!»
en: Now Isaiah   had said, “Let them take a lump of pressed figs and apply it to his infected skin, so that he may recover.”

ngiemboon: Ezekiyásè zɛ́te ngie: N ge lɔgɔ yɛ̌ liŋé tá zsé ngie n ge gíŋe gÿo gʉa ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a?
en: And Hezekiah had asked, “What is the sign that I will go up to the Lord’s temple? ”
